title: Liverpool v Tottenham: match preview
text:
Mauricio Pochettino’s struggling side confirmed “they have not forgotten how to play football”, as Jürgen Klopp put it, when they demolished Red Star Belgrade in midweek but a reunion with Liverpool may reopen insecurities. Tottenham faced Liverpool three times last season and lost on each occasion, with no reminder needed of what happened in the Champions League final 148 days ago. Anfield will provide plenty, however. The leaders are unbeaten in 44 league games at home and Spurs have won only once in their last 25 league visits. Andy Hunter

Sunday 4.30pm Sky Sports Premier League

Venue Anfield

Last season Liverpool 2 Tottenham 1

Referee Anthony Taylor

This season G8 Y30 R1 3.88 cards/game

Odds H 1-2 A 11-2 D 7-2

LIVERPOOL

Subs from Adrián, Lonergan, Kelleher, Milner, Keïta, Origi, Lovren, Gomez, Lallana, Oxlade-Chamberlain, Shaqiri, Brewster, Jones

Doubtful Matip (knee)

Injured Shaqiri (calf, Nov), Clyne (knee, Jan)

Suspended None

Discipline Y8 R0

Form WWWWWD

Leading scorer Mané 5

TOTTENHAM

Subs from Vorm, Whiteman, Foyth, Dier, Wanyama, Skipp, Moura, Oakley-Boothe, Walker-Peters, Lo Celso, Ndombele, Davies, Lamela, Eriksen

Doubtful None

Injured Sessegnon (hamstring, Nov), Lloris (elbow, unknown)

Suspended None

Discipline Y19 R1

Form DWLWLD

Leading scorer Kane 5
description: Tottenham faced Liverpool three times last season and lost on each occasion, with no reminder needed of what happened in the Champions League final
